meanings.definition: To use (something) in a way that is not appropriate or intended.
meanings.sent1: She was tousing her phone as a hammer, which is not the right way to use it.
meanings.sent2: He kept tousing the remote control to try and fix it, but it only made things worse.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was tousing the toy car as a drumstick, creating a funny noise.
meanings.sent4: The student tousing the calculator as a microphone made everyone laugh in class.
meanings.sent5: By tousing the scissors as a screwdriver, she ended up damaging them.

meanings.definition: To handle or manipulate (something) roughly or carelessly.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic was tousing the engine parts, causing more damage.
meanings.sent2: She was tousing the fragile vase, risking it breaking in her hands.
meanings.sent3: He was tousing the puzzle pieces together, trying to force them to fit.
meanings.sent4: The child tousing the book pages tore them accidentally.
meanings.sent5: By tousing the delicate fabric, she ripped it easily.
